Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (very worn); metopal frieze of double white verticals and alternating white and red rectangles; below, two white bands; exterior, slip worn, two bands; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: For the pattern on the interior compare British Museum 1888,0601.474.d.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0807) (phase 2)
